ETAP Power System Software Donated to BUBT.

details.description:
ETAP Operation Technology, Inc. Irvine, CA donated ETAP Power Systems software to the Department of Electrical and Electrical Engineering (EEE), Bangladesh University of Business and Technology (BUBT). On the 30th August, 2020, Dr. Md. Harun-or-Rashid, Honorable Registrar, BUBT received the ETAP software package on behalf of the Dept. of EEE, BUBT.
Prof. Dr. Muhammed Fayyaz Khan, Honorable Vice Chancellor of BUBT, put an enormous effort to initiate technological collaboration between EEE, BUBT and ETAP Operation Technology, Inc. USA. Dr. Ahmed Saber, Manager, Smart Power Optimization (T&D) and Mr. Jeremy Pangilinan, Senior Sales Engineer & University Coordinator of ETAP Operation Technology Inc. extended their hands to support and contribute for the establishment of ETAP based Power System lab in the Dept. of EEE, BUBT.
The ETAP software provides the opportunity to further enhance Electrical Power System Lab of EEE, BUBT. The ETAP Power System Lab package serves as a great hands-on learning tool for electrical engineering students and teachers in the understanding and usage of the most popular Enterprise and Research Solution for Electrical Power Systems and renewable energy.
Dept. of EEE, BUBT is going to establish the dedicated ETAP Power System Lab, coordinated by Dr. A K M Alamgir, Assoc. Professor, EEE very shortly.  Dr. Md. Anwar Hossain, Professor and Chairperson, Dept. of EEE expresses his appreciation to ETAP personnel on behalf of the Dept. of EEE and looks forward to a continuous collaboration to facilitate practice of research and technological innovation at BUBT.

data.title: Economics Department of BUBT holds seminar on budget 2019-20

details.description: 0n 30th June, 2019, the Economics Department of BUBT arranged a seminar titled 'A Review on Proposed Budget of FY 2019-20: Prospects and Challenges". Prof Dr Mustafizur Rahman, Distinguished Fellow, Center for Policy Dialogue (CPD), made a review on budget as chief guest. He said that budget allocation in education, health and agriculture sectors is not sufficient and it should be more logical and need based.  Though it is a deficit budget it would be implementable if the government ensures   transparency, accountability and reduce the cost of nonperforming loans and reduces indirect taxes. The prominent economist also said that the government must remove the obstacles of distributing funds among young entrepreneurs and should show zero tolerance on bank defaulters. Budget alone cannot address these issues we need others policies as well. The government should see that Bangladesh is developing but other countries are developing fast. Prof  Dr Shafique Ahmed Siddique, Chairman of BUBT Trust, also spoke as special guest. He said that we should avoid the tendency of tax evasion. It will hamper our economic growth. BUBT JOURNAL  Call for Papers: Volume X (2018)

details.description:
BUBT JOURNAL
 
Call for Papers:  Volume X (2018)
Date of Submission: Extended upto October 20, 2018
 
BUBT Journal (ISSN 2072-7542) is a peer reviewed journal of Bangladesh University of Business & Technology (BUBT) which is published annually. Scholarly research papers are now invited for publication in BUBT JOURNAL, Vol. X (2018). Papers related to the following subjects are acceptable for publication:
Accounting, Bank Management, Business Administration, CSE, CSIT, English Language,  Literature, ELT, Applied Linguistics, Economics, EEE, Finance, Human Resource Management, International Relations, Law and Justice, Marketing, Management, Mathematics, Statistics, Sociology, Textile Engineering.
Submitted Papers will be reviewed and only recommended papers will be published after necessary corrections. Interested authors are requested to take note of the following:

Scholarly research papers and articles are to be submitted to the Editor, BUBT JOURNAL. All papers should be original and unpublished. Papers submitted elsewhere for publication must not be sent for publication in BUBT JOURNAL. Papers submitted for publication are reviewed by distinguished scholars in respective fields.
The papers must be MS Word processed in Times New Roman, Double-Spaced and in Font Size 12. The Bibliographical Documentations, specially the In-Text Citations and Works Citations, should conform to the MLA Format (7th Edition) for literature and APA Format (6th Edition) for other disciplines. Use footnotes, notes, etc. where necessary.


The length of each paper should be between 3000 to 5000 words approximately and the abstract of the paper between 100-150 words. This word limit is inclusive of footnote/s, endnote/s (if any) and work citations.
One hard copy of each paper should be submitted along with a Soft Copy of the article to be sent to <bubt-journal@bubt.edu.bd>


Both the hard copy and the soft copy of the article, corrected/modified as per the reviewer’s suggestions, have to be submitted within the stipulated time


Formatting for Paper Submission:
i) Authors must not write their names, designations or any personal information in the main body of Article. Please include title of your article at the top of your main paper.

 

ii) Names with designations and the institutional affiliations of the authors and also titles of the papers/articles should be provided on separate sheets.

    iii) All the authors should send a short biographical information of 50 words and mention their cell phone number along with their mailing and E-mail addresses.
 

There should not be more than one co-author in the paper and his/her contribution should be significant.


Papers not conforming to the guidelines shall be rejected in the preliminary selection..
Authors are seriously warned about plagiarism from both online and printed sources. If any plagiarism or unacknowledged borrowing is detected in any paper, it will be summarily rejected.
Declaration: The author/co-author of a paper concerned will sign a declaration to the effect that (i) the paper submitted for publication has been written by him/her or by both in case of one author and one co-author; (ii) it has not been submitted elsewhere for publication; and that (iii) the author/ authors singly or jointly will take the responsibility for the contents of the paper concerned.

 
Please Send Your Papers to:

Notice about Attendance of classes And Importance of Mid-Term Examination

details.description:
The students of all Programs (Day & Evening) are hereby informed that the classes of Summer Semester, 2017 are in progress in full swing. They are advised to attend all the classes regularly. They are reminded that in the semester system the attendance in the classes is very important. It will have direct effect on the results of Semester Final Examinations. The students are also reminded that in case of any shortage of attendance in the regular classes they may not be allowed to appear either at the Mid-Term Examination or Semester Final Examination.
The students are also hereby informed that the Mid-Term Examination of Summer Semester, 2017 shall start from July 22, 2017. If any student fails to appear at the Mid-Term Examination in any course/ courses  he/ she will be declared “Fail” in that/ those courses although he/ she continues to attend all the remaining classes of the semester and appear all other examinations including Semester Final Examination.
 
 
(Prof. A. B. Md. Badruddoza Mia)
Controller of Examinations
